description: Raise the maximum allowed hotend temperature for your printer. Useful for high-temp filaments or upgraded hotends.
instructions: Increase the value, but do not exceed your hardware's safe limit.
Marlin will not allow nozzle temperature settings higher than the value of HEATER_0_MAXTEMP minus HOTEND_OVERSHOOT.
e.g. if HEATER_0_MAXTEMP = 375 and HOTEND_OVERSHOOT = 15 the maximum nozzle temperature is 360.
Save and upload the new configuration.
warnings: Default of 275 is to protect users against PTFE tube off-gassing. Only increase if you have an all-metal hotend.

description: Set the correct thermistor type for your hotend to ensure accurate temperature readings.
instructions: Set the value to match your thermistor type (see Marlin's thermistor table in the comments above this setting).
Save and upload the new configuration.
warnings: Incorrect thermistor type value will cause inaccurate readings and Marlin may shut down the printer.
